history.content: I just called the Math Adviser. He reports that all four units of Math 1A would count towards graduation and towards your GPA. Of course, this is an unorthodox decision to make and I would encourage you to speak to your ESS or L&S Adviser about alternative plans.

children.subject: I heard from some people that only the CS lower div classes are used in computing the GPA for declaration purpose. Don't quote me though.

Did you pass out of math 1a/1b with AP? Or why are you taking math 1a after math 54?

 

For the continuing students who were accepted to Cal prior to Fall 2015 (and need to earn a 3.0 in Math 1A, 1B, 54, and CS 61ABC, 70), while we do not recommend students to take math 1A/1B as a GPA booster, we will allow it. This will likely be the last semester that we would accept this. Instead of math 1A, I would recommend taking CS upper divs instead, as they are better indicators of success in the major, and you can still make progress without wasting a class. 

 

For students who are currently freshmen, only CS 61A, 61B, and 70 will apply to the GPA calculation.

 

Hope that helps!
Do you know how to the GPA would count towards CS declaration?

history.content:
How is GPA calculated when taking Math 1A after taking Math 54?

Thanks!
history.subject: Math 1A after Math 54
